Package com.eis.greenenergy.connection

This package represents the data model of the application and solely contains Async-tasks; every class in this package extends the Android-class android.os.AsyncTask.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    EnergyNowAccess
    Class which defines an AsyncTask to access energy data from an external database.
    Login
    Class which defines an AsyncTask to access the user-login-data stored in an external database.
    Predictions
    Class which defines an AsyncTask to access energy prediction data from an external database.
    ScoreStorage
    Class which defines an AsyncTask to update the score value of a user in an external database.
    Signup
    Class which define an AsyncTask to insert new user data into an external database.
    SyncScore
    Class which defines an AsyncTask to access the score value of a user stored in an external database.
    TwitterUpdate
    Class which defines an AsyncTask for connecting to the Twitter Api.

Package com.eis.greenenergy.connection Description

This package represents the data model of the application and solely contains Async-tasks; every class in this package extends the Android-class android.os.AsyncTask. The purpose of these Async-tasks is to connect to the external Twitter API or to connect to an external web-server in order to update or retrieve data.
The Async-tasks Login and Signup are necessary to conduct the log in and sign up process.
The task SyncScore enables the access of the latest score of an user stored in an external database. Similar to this task is the Async-task ScoreStorage which is used to update the score of an user in the external database.
The tasks EnergyNowAccess and Predictions allow to retrieve data about the current amount of green energy as well as predictions for certain hours in the future.
The Async-task TwitterUpdate enables to access the Twitter API and to send Tweets from the user's Twitter account.
Since:
2014-07-25
Version:
1.3
Author:
Veronika Henk, Sarvenaz Golchin, Mahnaz Hajibaba
